content:
Welcome to the SubBio-Mon official eDNA website. Here is displayed all the information that is involved for eDNA. On this website you will be able to learn about the how to sample eDNA in cave environment as well as the result that are produced during our different field work.
The world of subterranean biodiversity is only starting to be discovered and has yet to tell all their secrets.

an example to get you started

title: oliviercollard

content:
Materials and Equipment # For the sampling protocol we use the eDNA sampling kit from Sylphium as well as a car oil vacuum pump extraction oil vacuum pump extraction
Sampling protocol # For cave environment it ask to sample 3 area of the cave
A percolation (accumulation outside of rivers) The underground river The spring of the cave (exit of the cave’s river) A blank For each site, 3 replicates of at least 5-10 litter should be done.
For each cave, a sampling blank has to be done. The blank consist of filtering at least 5-10 liters of ultra pure water after entering the cave and has to be filtered during the first sampling activity.
Sampling procedure #
title: Sampling
